poem:
The Star's Lounge

On a sofa, timeless,  
Clairo drapes music  
with velvet voice  
and corduroy echoes—  
notes warm as wood,  
light as era's air.  

A glint on the wall  
catches the curve  
of her charm;  

a lizard asleep  
in the soft sunlight—  
dreaming soul  
in yesterday's glow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Clairo review – charming pop-soul from a singer with starpower to spare Charm, the third album from 26-year-old US singer-songwriter Clairo, was one of last year’s best: 1970s-skewing pop-soul where you could almost sense the warmth of the era’s wood, velvet and corduroy. Played live on this sold-out tour, the lounge-lizard feeling intensifies as her band perform on what looks like an epically proportioned sofa, backed by an elegantly glinting feature wall. Clairo sweeps around". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Clairo review – charming pop-soul from a singer with starpower to spare Charm, the third album from 26-year-old US singer-songwriter Clairo, was one of last year’s best: 1970s-skewing pop-soul where you could almost sense the warmth of the era’s wood, velvet and corduroy. Played live on this sold-out tour, the lounge-lizard feeling intensifies as her band perform on what looks like an epically proportioned sofa, backed by an elegantly glinting feature wall. Clairo sweeps around
